discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
o use encryption, a keyring component or plugin must be installed and configured

choices.B: It can be set at run time.
choices.E: It can be activated per session.
choices.A: It encrypts any connecting slaves connection thread.
choices.D: When enabled it encrypts existing binary logs.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the binary log encryption feature? (Choose two.)

A clean shutdown was performed with innodb_fast_shutdown=0.
While you were manipulating files, all files were accidentally deleted from the top-level data directory.
Which two files must be restored from backup to allow the DB to restart cleanly? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Its a complete shutdown, most files are not needed. . DE

choices.F: This file is for storing MySQL server_uuid values only.
choices.B: This file is for logging purposes only and is never processed.
choices.C: It is read and processed at the beginning of startup configuration.
choices.E: It is always updated with changes to system variables.
choices.D: It is read and processed at the end of startup configuration.
choices.A: This file is for storing MySQL Server configuration options in ISON format.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the mysqld-auto.cnf file? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
Not A, nothing to do with configuration. 
E, when changes are made, it is saved.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
This JSON-format file contains persisted system variable setting

choices.B: Define CREATE USER ''@'%' IDENTIFIED WITH sha256_password in the MySQL instance.

comments.content:
Not A, binlog is off.
Not B. max_connections has nothing to do with it. 
C. innodb_log_file_size --- yes. The default value is 50 megs. This file filling up could cause rollbacks from aborted queries. 
D. innodb_doublewrite=0 -- yes. 
Not E. 1 is actually worse. 
Not F. We have more memory than data. 

So C and D.
this question is the same with number 4.

discussion.content:
AD and not E, trx 1 uses more io than 2. 
max connections and memory are fine also.

Selected Answer: DE
Although data is written twice, the doublewrite buffer does not require twice as much I/O overhead or twice as many I/O operations

The data in this instance is transient; no backup or replication will be required. It is currently under performing.
The database size is static and including indexes is 19G.
Total system memory is 32G.
After profiling the system, you highlight these MySQL status and global variables:
//IMG//

The OS metrics indicate that disk is a bottleneck.
Other variables retain their default values.
Which two changes will provide the most benefit to the instance? (Choose two.)
